STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 17, 2021
Melissa VanLuven
2218 Shunk Road
Sault Ste Marie, MI 49783
RE: License #: CN170201399
Sault Tribe Binogii - Placement
2218 Shunk Road
Sault Ste Marie, MI 49783
Dear Ms. VanLuven:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on August 5,
2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
Modified Implementation, Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written
corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules
are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15
days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, Area Manager, at 616-552-3662.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 383-5531
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by
another agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record
containing all of the following documents:
(b) Documentation that the foster parent is willing to
accept the foster child.
Three borrowed home files were reviewed. One of three files documented that foster
parent acceptance signatures occurred after the child placement. The child was
placed on February 16, 2021, and the foster parent signatures were dated February
19, 2021.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(c) A copy of the initial evaluation with written endorsement
by the borrowing agency that the evaluation is acceptable.
Three borrowed home files were reviewed. Two of three files documented written
endorsement of the initial evaluation after the child was placed. One file documented
placement of the child on September 15, 2020, and the endorsement was dated
September 30, 2020. A second file documented placement of the child on February
16, 2021, and the endorsement was dated February 19, 2021.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(d) A copy of the current reevaluation with written
endorsement by the borrowing agency that the evaluation is
acceptable.
4

Three borrowed home files were reviewed. One of 3 files documented placement of
the child on February 16, 2021, and the endorsement was dated February 19, 2021.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(f) Documentation that the foster parent has received
orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency.
Three borrowed home files were reviewed. One of 3 files documented placement of
the child on February 16, 2021, and the file documented that the foster parent
received the agency policies on February 22, 2021.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(g) A copy of the foster parent /agency agreement signed by
the foster parent and the borrowing agency.
Three borrowed home files were reviewed. One of 3 files documented placement of
the child on February 16, 2021, and the parent/agency agreement was signed on
February 22, 2021.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
Five files and 13 service plans were reviewed. One of 5 files contained a service
plan that was late. The plan was due on October 31, 2020, and was completed on
November 1, 2020.
5

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
FOM 801 Medical Passport
All medical information within the medical passport must be
current and updated at least quarterly to reflect the child's
current and complete health information.
Five files and 13 service plans were reviewed. One of 5 files was missing a quarterly
updated medical passport. There was a gap between December 2, 2020, and June
10, 2021, where the medical passport was not updated and signed.
The is a repeat violation. The original violation was established during the June 4,
2020, renewal inspection and an acceptable corrective action plan was received on
June 23, 2020.
6

FOM 722-06H Timely entry of social work contacts.
The caseworker must enter the required face-to-face contacts
listed below in MISACWIS within five business days of the
contact. This includes attempted and missed face-to-face
contacts. • Any face-to-face contact with children, parents, or
caregivers made by any of the following: Foster care
caseworker/supervisor. CPS caseworker/supervisor. Adoption
caseworker/supervisor. Permanency resource monitors.
Education planners. Michigan Youth Opportunities Initiative
coordinators. • Parent/child face-to-face contacts. • Sibling face-
to-face contacts. All other case contacts must be entered prior
to the report period end date on the applicable case service
plan.
Five files and 13 service plans were reviewed. One of 5 files contained a face to face
contact that was entered late. The contact occurred on April 23, 2021 and was
entered on May 3, 2021.
The is a repeat violation. The original violation was established during the June 4,
2020, renewal inspection and an acceptable corrective action plan was received on
June 23, 2020.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical assistance was not required.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not requested or required at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
An acceptable corrective action plan was received on June 23, 2020, in response to
7

those rule and policy violations established during the June 4, 2020, renewal
inspection.
There were no special investigations during the licensing period.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
August 6, 2021
________________________________________
Doug Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
August 17, 2021

Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
